prompt: Present-day hackathon hall at TAMU Tidal Hackathon: neon LED strips, rain streaks on tall windows, vapor/fog in the air, rows of laptops like glowing battle stations. Whip-pan between a giant countdown timer and a blinking cursor on his screen; his lanyard/badge sways as teammates hover, tense and whisper-arguing behind him. - TAMU Tidal Hackathon branding
audio_description: EMCEE (VO, thunderous arena tone): "You have 24 hours… to build something impossible." Underneath: keyboard clacks, distant cheers, low bass rumble. Teammate (hushed): "Our demo’s dead." Aarav (whisper): "Then we revive it."

prompt: Extreme close-up of Aarav’s badge QR code. The QR ripples like liquid and morphs into spinning blueprint lines; cyan schematic grids crawl across his hands as he reaches forward. Match-cut from laptop vent spinning fan to a swirling dust vortex, as marble textures and architectural linework flood the frame. - TAMU Tidal Hackathon branding
audio_description: Laptop fan rises into a deep, temple-like hum; crackling electric whoosh. Heartbeat-like thump synced to the rotating schematic.

prompt: Agra, 1630s: warm golden light, marble dust floating in sunbeams. A massive Taj Mahal construction site with towering bamboo/wood scaffolds; elephants hauling stone blocks; artisans inlaying patterns; ropes lifting calligraphy panels. Aarav stumbles into frame in modern clothes; Ustad Kamil steadies him with a firm hand and thrusts a rolled plan into his arms. Close-up of a chalk alignment line trembling, slightly off, threatening a cascading misfit. - TAMU Tidal Hackathon branding
audio_description: Ambient: hammering, rope creaks, distant elephant calls. Ustad Kamil (subtitled, calm but stern): "A line off by a finger… becomes a flaw for centuries." Aarav (subtitled): "In my world, bugs do the same."

prompt: Night on the build: torches flicker, rain begins, the dome framework groans under tension. Aarav pulls out his phone and uses a level app; overlays of glowing gridlines align with the dome ribs. He sketches a modular workflow directly onto the plan; teams re-route materials in synchronized motion. A rope snaps in slow motion; Aarav lunges and braces a beam with a heroic shove as workers lock it in place. Close-up: marble dust clings to his hackathon badge, blending eras. - TAMU Tidal Hackathon branding
audio_description: Rising percussion, rain hiss on stone, rope twang then SNAP. Aarav (urgent): "Small parts. Clear handoffs. One truth." Ustad Kamil (resolute): "Great works are not born in a day… they are finished by teams who refuse to stop."

prompt: The dome silhouette dissolves into a curved projector screen back at TAMU Tidal Hackathon. Aarav jolts at his desk; timer reads 00:07:30. Rapid montage: he strips features, snaps code into clean modules; teammates lean in and sync—hands flying over keyboard, trackpad, and sticky notes—no arguing, just coordinated execution. The demo runs flawlessly on the big screen. - TAMU Tidal Hackathon branding
audio_description: Hard cut back to hackathon ambience: countdown beeps, fast typing, controlled breathing. Aarav: "Ship the core. Lock the handoffs." A clean success chime hits as the app output loads.

prompt: Stage-wide moment: applause in the hackathon hall. Close-up of Aarav’s badge—tiny smear of marble dust visible for a beat, then gone. He gives a quiet, certain smile as the camera pulls back to the glowing event space. - TAMU Tidal Hackathon branding
